intro: Onosma sinica, commonly known as Chinese onosma, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
